name: slider
content:
slider noun [C]
(ON MACHINE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
a part on a machine, computer, etc. that is used to control something, for example the volume that something is played at: These videos all have a volume slider.

slider noun [C]
(FOOD)
mainly US a type of small sandwich, especially a small hamburger, served as a snack or at the start of a meal: pork sliders The slider was served on a small grilled bun.
LauriPatterson/E+/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examplesWe used the leftovers to make sliders the following day.I had a pork belly slider with onions and relish.The sliders came with mayonnaise on them, which really spoiled them for me.

slider noun [C]
(BASEBALL)
in baseball, a throw in which the ball moves towards or away from the batter (= the player who tries to hit the ball) as it reaches them: He throws mostly sliders and curveballs. I had trouble hitting his slider.
